item.title: AL: 2. Selection Sort
item.description: This blog is used as notes for later reference after reading the book ‘Algorithms an illustrated guide for programmers’ Chapter 2: Selection Sort 1. Tips About Selection Sort Your computer’s memory is like a giant set of drawers. When you want to store multiple elements, use an array or a list. With an array, all your elements are stored right next to each other. With a list, elements are strewn all over, and one element stores the address of the next one.

item.title: AL: 1. Binary Search
item.description: This blog is used as notes for later reference after reading the book ‘Algorithms an illustrated guide for programmers’ Chapter 1: Binary Search 1. Tips About Binary Search * Binary search is a lot faster than simple search. * O(log n) is faster than O(n), but it gets a lot faster once the list of items you’re searching through grows. * Algorithm speed isn’t measured in seconds. * Algorithm times are measured in terms of growth of an algorithm.

item.title: TOEFL W2: Money_support_for_arts_or_sports
item.description: A/D: Governments should spend more money supporting the arts than supporting athletics such as an Olympic team. [Opening Sentence] Even though there are limited government resources for arts and sports funding, money is often misspent on athletics and Olympic teams. [Thesis statement] However, I believe that governments should put more resources and money on art projects since it will bring a lot more benefits to society and people. [Topic 1] Through their creation of the arts, some people become larger-than-life inspirations to everyone.
